column5: # formal definition
# a member of the species homo sapiens
# a typically mythical being that resembles a human, addressed as "he" or "she"
# an animal that can be empathized with, addressed as "he" or "she"
# moves, but not subject to empathy, addressed as "it"
# a sessile animal
# a sessile animal
# note the order: papercuts can string, but they have no stinger
# eats some kind of animal upon its death
# eats some kind of plant
# eats some kind of plant and animal
# eats some kind of animal by killing it
# eats some kind of dead animal or refuse
# consumes some kind of animal in some way without killing it
# drinks nectar
# drinks blood
# eats grass
# eats seeds
# eats carrots
# eats berries
# eats refuse
# eats carrion
# drinks nectar
# eats insects
# eats fish
# eats snakes
# eats big game, like deer
# eats small game, like rabbits
# not strictly aquatic, humans swim too
# note the order, cats scratch and lobsters pinch
# note the order, cats scratch and lobsters pinch
# note the order, insects have eyes and technically see but "the insect sees" is an odd statement because they do not perceive as we do
# I know it's not technically the case, it's just easier this way
# not strictly anthropomorphizable, to be anthropomorphizable requires being nonhuman, and humans are primates
# not strictly arboreal, humans are not arboreal
